info.title: Flintlock MicroVM API
info.description: The Flintlock MicroVM API handles operations for provisioning and managing microvms

NetworkInterfaceIfaceType.description:
- MACVTAP: MACVTAP represents a network interface that is macvtap.
 - TAP: TAP represents a network interface that is a tap.

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

typesInitrd.description: Initrd represents the configuration for the initial ramdisk.

image.description: Image is the container image to use.

cmdline.description:
Cmdline is the additional kernel command line args. Each provider has its
own recommended list, they will be used automatically. This field is for
additional values.

filename.description:
Filename is used to specify the name of the kernel file
in the Image.

addNetworkConfig.description: AddNetworkConfig if set to true indicates that the network-config kernel argument should be generated.

typesKernel.description: Kernel represents the configuration for a kernel.

items.description:
Items allows you to specify data items that present the metadata. The key is the name
of the metadata item and the value is the base64 encoded contents of the metadata.

addVolume.description:
AddVolume is set to true will add the metadata items to a volume and attach it as the second
disk (vdb). Defaults to false.

typesMetadata.description: Metadata represents the metadata for the microvm.

spec.description: Spec is the specification of the microvm.

status.description: Status is the runtime status of the microvm.

typesMicroVM.description: MicroVM represents a microvm machine that is created via a provider.

id.description:
ID is the identifier of the microvm.
If this empty at creation time a ID will be automatically generated.

namespace.description: Namespace is the name of the namespace the microvm belongs to.

labels.description: Labels allows you to include extra data for the microvms.

vcpu.description: VCPU specifies how many vcpu the machine will be allocated.

memoryInMb.description: MemoryInMb is the amount of memory in megabytes that the machine will be allocated.

kernel.description: Kernel is the details of the kernel to use .

initrd.description: Initrd is the optional details of the initial ramdisk.

rootVolume.description: RootVolume specifies the root volume mount for the MicroVM.

additionalVolumes.description: AdditionalVolumes specifies the volumes to be attached to the microvm.

interfaces.description:
Interfaces specifies the network interfaces to be attached to the microvm.
Device names on the guest machine are determined by the order defined in
the list starting from eth1, eth2, ..., ethN.

metadata.description: Metadata allows you to specify metadata for the microvm.

createdAt.description: CreatedAt indicates the time the microvm was created at.

updatedAt.description: UpdatedAt indicates the time the microvm was last updated.

deletedAt.description: DeletedAt indicates the time the microvm was marked as deleted.

uid.description: UID is a globally unique identifier of the microvm.

typesMicroVMSpec.description: MicroVMSpec represents the specification for a microvm.

state.description: State stores information about the last known state of the vm and the spec.

volumes.description: Volumes holds the status of the volumes.

kernelMount.description: KernelMount holds the status of the kernel mount point.

initrdMount.description: InitrdMount holds the status of the initrd mount point.

networkInterfaces.description: NetworkInterfaces holds the status of the network interfaces.

retry.description: Retry is a counter about how many times we retried to reconcile.

typesMicroVMStatus.description: MicroVMStatus contains the runtime status of the microvm.

type.description: Type specifies the type of the mount (e.g. device or directory).

source.description: Source is the location of the mounted volume.

typesMount.description: Mount represents a volume mount point.

deviceId.description:
DeviceID is the ID of the interface. There is no relation between the ID
and the name of the interface device on the quest machine.

type.description: IfaceType specifies the type of network interface to create for use by the guest.

guestMac.description:
GuestMAC allows the specifying of a specifi MAC address to use for the interface. If
not supplied a autogenerated MAC address will be used.

address.description:
Address is an optional static IP address to manually assign to this interface. 
If not supplied then DHCP will be used.

overrides.description: Overrides is optional overrides applicable for network configuration.

hostDeviceName.description:
HostDeviceName is the name of the network interface used from the host. This will be
a tuntap or macvtap interface.

index.description: Index is the index of the network interface on the host.

macAddress.description: MACAddress is the MAC address of the host interface.

bridgeName.description:
BridgeName is the name of the Linux bridge to attach TAP devices to. This overrides
any value set at the overall flintlock level.

typesNetworkOverrides.description: NetworkOverrides represents override values for a network interface.

address.description:
Address is the static IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) to assign to this interface.
Must be CIDR notation.

gateway.description: Gateway is used to optionaly set the default gateway for IPv4 or IPv6.

nameservers.description: Nameservers allows you to optionaly specify nameservers for the interface.

typesStaticAddress.description: StaticAddress represents a static IPv4 or IPv6 address.

id.description: ID is the uinique identifier of the volume.

isReadOnly.description: IsReadOnly specifies that the volume is to be mounted readonly.

source.description: Source is where the volume will be sourced from.

typesVolume.description: Volume represents the configuration for a volume to be attached to a microvm.

containerSource.description: Container is used to specify a source of a volume as a OCI container.

typesVolumeSource.description: VolumeSource is the source of a volume. Based loosely on the volumes in Kubernetes Pod specs.

mount.description: Mount represents a volume mount point.
